byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and SUSANNE CRAIG

abstract: New York State Assemblyman Carl E Heastie of Bronx is poised to succeed embattled Sheldon Silver, who agreed to step down as Assembly speaker in wake of federal charges of accepting millions of dollars in payoffs; would be chamber's first African-American speaker.
lead_paragraph: After the last of four challengers dropped out, Mr. Heastie, whose ascent has not been stopped by reports that his campaign spending was once under scrutiny, became the sole candidate for the post.

headline.main: Carl Heastie, Legislator From Bronx, Is Poised to Become New York Assembly Speaker
headline.print_headline: Legislator From Bronx Is Poised to Win Role

snippet: After the last of four challengers dropped out, Mr. Heastie, whose ascent has not been stopped by reports that his campaign spending was once under scrutiny, became the sole candidate for the post.

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
